column4: dpkg-reconfigure is not installed in my 32bit chrooted environment. How do i install it?
sudo apt-get install debconf
it says debconf is already the newest version
dpkg -S dpkg-reconfigure
debconf: /usr/sbin/dpkg-reconfigure
ahh.. you already said so. thanks for your help
edit /etc/environment
/usr/local/sbin appears to be in PATH in that file, but perhaps it isn't loaded by dchroot ?
it should be, i have used dchroots in the past without any issues
hm ok.. perhaps i set up something wrongly..
you are not allowed to have symblinks from the chroot to out of it
you're right.. it's in the fstab now i come to think of it
those are bind mounts, yes, be carefull, if you dont unmount them, you may delete real "mounts" contents
Exactly. how do i unbind them. Unmount says (of course) that the device is busy
you must get out of the chroot
I would recommend you to use schroot instead, is easy to use and safer
